00097 /*
00098     @brief Initializes the circular buffer.
00099 
00100     @param cbuf Points to the structure to be initialized.
00101 */
00102 static void init_circ_buf(tcirc_buf *cbuf)
00103 {
00104     cbuf->head = cbuf->tail = 0;
00105 }
00106 
00107 /*
00108     @brief This will add a character to the circular buffer.
00109 
00110     @param cbuf Pointer to structure that contains data.
00111     @param ch Character to add to buffer.
00112 */
00113 static void add_to_circ_buf(tcirc_buf *cbuf, u8 ch)
00114 {
00115     // Add char to buffer
00116     u8 newhead = cbuf->head;
00117     newhead++;
00118     if (newhead >= BUFSIZE)
00119         newhead = 0;
00120     while (newhead == cbuf->tail)
00121         if (rx)
00122             // In Rx mode, waiting won't help, we're inside of interrupt!!
00123             return;
00124         else
00125             cdc_task();
00126 
00127 
00128     cbuf->buf[cbuf->head] = ch;
00129     cbuf->head = newhead;
00130 }
00131 
00132 /*
00133     @brief This will get a character out of the circular buffer.
00134 
00135     @param cbuf Pointer to structure that contains data.
00136 
00137     @return retval Character to be returned from buffer.  If no char
00138     is available, returns SERIAL_ERR.
00139 */
00140 static u8 get_from_circ_buf(tcirc_buf *cbuf)
00141 {
00142     // Get char from buffer
00143     // Be sure to check first that there is a char in buffer
00144     u8 newtail = cbuf->tail;
00145     u8 retval = cbuf->buf[newtail];
00146 
00147     if (newtail == cbuf->head)
00148         return SERIAL_ERR;
00149 
00150     newtail++;
00151     if (newtail >= BUFSIZE)
00152         // Rollover
00153         newtail = 0;
00154     cbuf->tail = newtail;
00155 
00156     return retval;
00157 }
00158 
00159 /*
00160     @brief This will determine if there is a character in the circular buffer.
00161 
00162     @param cbuf Pointer to structure that contains data.
00163 
00164     @retval true if buffer contains data.
00165     @retval false if buffer is empty.
00166 */
00167 static u8 circ_buf_has_char(tcirc_buf *cbuf)
00168 {
00169     // Return true if buffer empty
00170     return (cbuf->head != cbuf->tail);
00171 }
00172 
00173 /*
00174    @brief Returns the number of stored chars in the circular buffer.
00175 
00176    @param cbuf is the circular buffer to query
00177 
00178    @return count Number of chars in buffer.
00179  */
00180 static u8 circ_buf_count(tcirc_buf *cbuf)
00181 {
00182     s16 count;
00183 
00184     count = cbuf->head - cbuf->tail;
00185     if (count < 0)
00186         count += BUFSIZE;
00187     return (u8) count;
00188 }

00207 void serial_init(t_rx_handler rxh)
00208 {
00209     // Initialize the buffers
00210     init_circ_buf(&rxbuf);
00211     init_circ_buf(&txbuf);
00212 
00213     if (PLATFORM == RAVENUSB)
00214         uart_usb_init();
00215     else
00216     {
00217         // Enable RX,TX and RX interrupt on USART
00218         USART_SETUP();
00219         
00220         // save pointer to rx handler function
00221         rx_handler = rxh;
00222         
00223         // Init the RCB_BB if necessary
00224         if (PLATFORM < RAVEN) // RCB's only
00225             INIT_RCB_BB();
00226     }
00227 }

00245 void serial_putchar(char ch)
00246 {
00247     // If we're paused, don't send anything
00248     if (pause)
00249         return;
00250 
00251     // Interrupts really should be on here
00252     sei();
00253 
00254     // Add byte to transmit buffer
00255     add_to_circ_buf(&txbuf, ch);
00256 
00257     // Send the first byte if nothing is yet being sent
00258     // This is determined by seeing if the TX complete interrupt is
00259     // enabled.
00260     if (PLATFORM != RAVENUSB && USART_CHAR_READY())
00261     {
00262         // Wait for the UDR buffer to get emptied.
00263         while (USART_DRE_WAIT())
00264             ;
00265         // Feed the first byte to get the transmission started.
00266         USART_REG = get_from_circ_buf(&txbuf);
00267 
00268         // Enable the UART Data Register Empty interrupt.
00269         USART_DRE_ENABLE();
00270     }
00271 }

00327 s8 serial_getchar(void)
00328 {

00330     while (!circ_buf_count(&rxbuf))

00347 u8 serial_gets(char *str, u8 len, u8 echo)
00348 {
00349     u8 count=0;                 // Number of characters we have so far
00350     u8 ch;
00351 
00352     for(;;)
00353     {
00354         ch = serial_getchar();
00355         if (count > len - 2 &&
00356             ch != '\r' &&
00357             ch != 8)
00358             continue;
00359         if (echo)
00360             serial_putchar(ch);
00361         switch(ch)
00362         {
00363         case '\r':
00364             // end of input
00365             *str = 0;
00366             return count;
00367         case 8:
00368             // backspace
00369             if (count)
00370             {
00371                 count--;
00372                 *str-- = 0;
00373             }
00374             break;
00375         default:
00376             // just another char for string
00377             *str++ = ch;
00378             count++;
00379             break;
00380         }
00381     }
00382 }

00413 u8 serial_rcv_frame(void)
00414 {
00415     if (PLATFORM == RAVEN && SERIAL)
00416     {
00417         // Gets a serial frame, if any, and displays data appropriately
00418         // If wait_for_ack is true, this funtion will wait for serial chars.
00419         u8 ch;
00420         static u8 ndx;
00421         
00422         if (!serial_ischar())
00423             return false;
00424         
00425         ch = serial_getchar();
00426         
00427         switch (SerialFrame->state)
00428         {
00429         case sof:
00430             // looking for SOF
00431             if (ch == SOF_CHAR)
00432                 SerialFrame->state = len;
00433             else
00434                 SerialFrame->state = sof;
00435             break;
00436         case len:
00437             // Got SOF, looking for len
00438             if (ch > SERIAL_PAYLOAD_LEN)
00439                 ch = SERIAL_PAYLOAD_LEN;
00440             SerialFrame->len = ch;
00441             SerialFrame->state = cmd;
00442             ndx = 0;
00443             break;
00444         case cmd:
00445             // Get cmd
00446             SerialFrame->cmd = ch;
00447             SerialFrame->state = payload;
00448             break;
00449         case payload:
00450             // Grab  payload
00451             if (ndx < SerialFrame->len)
00452             {
00453                 SerialFrame->payload[ndx++] = ch;
00454                 break;
00455             }
00456             else
00457                 // All done with payload
00458                 SerialFrame->state = eof;
00459             // Fall through here, intentionally, since there was no payload.
00460         case eof:
00461             // Start over with next char rx'd
00462             SerialFrame->state = sof;
00463             // Find EOF or else
00464             if (ch == EOF_CHAR)
00465                 // All done
00466                 return true;
00467             break;
00468         default:
00469             SerialFrame->state = sof;
00470             break;
00471         }
00472     }
00473     return false;
00474 }

00476 void serial_send_frame(u8 cmd, u8 payload_length, u8 *payload)
00477 {
00478     if (PLATFORM == RAVEN && SERIAL)
00479     {
00480         // Send a frame to 3290P
00481         u8 i;
00482         
00483         serial_putchar(SOF_CHAR);
00484         serial_putchar(payload_length);
00485         serial_putchar(cmd);
00486         for (i=0;i<=payload_length-1;i++)
00487             serial_putchar(payload[i]);
00488         serial_putchar(EOF_CHAR);
00489     }
00490 }

00499 ISR(USARTRXVECT)
00500 {
00501     // Get byte from serial port
00502     u8 ch = USART_REG;
00503 
00504     // Put character in Rx Buffer.
00505     rx = true;
00506     add_to_circ_buf(&rxbuf, ch);
00507     rx = false;
00508 
00509     // And call user's RX handler function
00510     if (rx_handler)
00511         rx_handler(ch);
00512 }
00513 
00517 ISR(USARTTXVECT)
00518 {
00519     if (circ_buf_has_char(&txbuf))
00520         // Feed a byte
00521         USART_REG = get_from_circ_buf(&txbuf);
00522     else
00523         // No more chars to send, disable this interrupt
00524         USART_DRE_DISABLE();
00525 }
